714966f-a.text:
19 East 103rd Street, nerth side between 5th and Madison Avenues and East 103rd to East 104th Street, showing the Patrick Henry High School, or P.S. 171.
Board of Education, N.Y.C.
1920.

722916f-a.text:
Riverside Park: Three views photographed in a northward (views 1 & 2) and westward (No. 3) direction from a point near West 103rd Street. Across the Hudson River appears the Palisades of New Jersey.
June 7, 1921.
Walter L. Bogert.

715529f-a.text:
31-1 West 130th Street, west of, adjoining and at the N.W. corner of Fifth Avenue. The Church of the Puritans (Presbyterian)
is in the right centre.
July S1,1932.
P.L. Sperr.

722918f-c.text:
Riverside Park, north from a point near West 103rd Street, showing paths and embankments in this narrow garden spot that parallels the North (Hudson) River. The New York Central Railroad tracks seen, will in 1938 be moved slightly eastward and covered over; their former site and marginal land being landscaped in the West Side Improvement Project. This set consists of 3 views from different angles; No. 3 of which is
several years later.
Views 1 & 2:eApril 3, 1932.
View 3:-June 17, 1934.
P. L. Sperr.

May 18, 1933.

709206f-a.text:
Fifth Avenue, east side, north from E. 103rd to E. 106th Streets, showing the Museum of the City of New York (Nos. 1220-1227) from East 103rd to E. 104th Streets; the Heckscher Foundation for Children,GIos. 1230-1237) from E. 104th to E. 105th Streets; and the Fifth Avenue Hospital (Nos. 1240-1248) from E. 105th to E. 106th Streets. The
vantage point is Central Park.
1936
W.P.A. Photo
Federal Writers Project
